result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Mullikin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael R Mullikin in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF pleads NC.
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts
Court accepts plea, finds guilty
 Court imposes: Sentence withheld, 1 year probation, complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.    Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.  Absolute Sobriety,   No drug use without a valid prescription. No abusive contact with Sarah Mack. Costs of $ 443.00   Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  Transfer probation to Douglas County.

Defendant Michael R Mullikin in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Marcoux: DEF did not make arrangements prior to today. Gave DEF offer letter.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael R Mullikin in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews court appointed attorney paperwork - which was denied by the court.  Defendant would like to waive right to attorney and will talk with DA to resolve. Court finds defendant waives right to counsel. Bond Continues  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
